title: Manchester United fear difficulties in landing new signings in January transfer window
text:
Solskjaer wants more options upfront (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United are concerned about the difficulties of signing any new players in the January transfer window, according to reports.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is desperate to bring in attacking reinforcements when the winter window opens after a number of injuries to his forward line.

Anthony Martial has missed most of the season, while Marcus Rashford too has been struggling with injuries.

United failed to replace Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku during the summer and Manchester Evening News claim Solskjaer has asked for that issue to be addressed.

Mandzukic has been linked with a switch to United (Picture: Getty)

The lengthy negotiations to sign Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire forced United to put plans to replace Sanchez and Lukaku on hold.

Ander Herrera also left United on a free transfer and no midfielder arrived at United to take the Spaniard’s spot in the squad.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But there is little optimism from within the club that they will be able to find suitable replacements in January.

United are prepared to do business in January, but are wary of a market that is often driven by ‘desperation’ of clubs to sign reinforcements.

The Red Devils sit just two points above the relegation zone in the Premier League table ahead of a busy winter period.

Rashford and Martial have suffered with injuries this season (Picture: Getty)

Solskjaer has already bemoaned the number of injuries his team has had to deal with so far this season, but the depth of the squad has also been an issue.

United are targeting at least four significant signings in 2020, but it appears unlikely any of those will come in January.

Leicester City’s James Maddison and Borussia Dortmund’s Jadon Sancho remain top targets for United next summer.

It is unclear who United will sign in January after Solskjaer passed on the chance to Mario Mandzukic and Fernando Llorente before the start of the new campaign.
